fr.reflexe.viewshell.api.http

Interface IFormConstraints


  • public interface IFormConstraints
    Provides access to constraints for processing multipart HTTP content, such as file uploads.

    The default constraints are:

    • 16 files
    • 16 megabytes per file
    • no time limit

    If these constraints are violated, an exception will be thrown when accessing the multipart HTTP content. By default, this triggers sending of an HTTP error code (and terminates the response), although this can be set to simply throw exceptions without sending an error code and without terminating the response, if required.

    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    REFLEXE Technologies

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int getFileUploadQuantityLimit()
      Gets the maximum number of files to be processed in a multipart file upload request.
      long getFileUploadSizeLimit()
      Gets the maximum size of each file to be processed in a multipart file upload request.
      long getFileUploadTimeLimit()
      Gets the maximum amount of total time allowed for processing file uploads.
      boolean isHttpErrorModeEnabled()
      Indicates if violation of these constraints should cause an HTTP error to be sent back to the client.

      Sets the maximum number of files to be processed in a multipart file upload request.

      Determines whether violation of these constraints should cause an HTTP error to be sent back to the client, or not.

    • Method Detail

      • isHttpErrorModeEnabled

        boolean isHttpErrorModeEnabled()
        Indicates if violation of these constraints should cause an HTTP error to be sent back to the client. Doing so will automatically close the response.
        Returns:
        true (the default), or false if disabled.
        Since:
        1.0

      • setHttpErrorModeEnabled

        void setHttpErrorModeEnabled(boolean useHttpErrors)
        Determines whether violation of these constraints should cause an HTTP error to be sent back to the client, or not.
        Parameters:
        useHttpErrors - enables this feature if true (any errors will cause an HTTP error and immediate closure of the response), disabling it if false.
        Since:
        1.0

      • getFileUploadTimeLimit

        long getFileUploadTimeLimit()
        Gets the maximum amount of total time allowed for processing file uploads. If this limit is exceeded, then file upload processing is halted.

        If HTTP errors are enabled, and if this constraint is violated, then the HTTP error status REQUEST TIMEOUT will be sent back to the client and the response will be closed.

        Returns:
        the maximum amount of total time allowed for processing file uploads, in milliseconds. A value of 0 indicates no limit.
        Since:
        1.0

      • setFileUploadTimeLimit

        void setFileUploadTimeLimit(long timeLimit)
        Sets the maximum amount of total time allowed for processing file uploads.
        Parameters:
        timeLimit - the time limit, in milliseconds. If 0, interpreted as "no time limit" (negative values are coerced to 0).
        Since:
        1.0

      • getFileUploadQuantityLimit

        int getFileUploadQuantityLimit()
        Gets the maximum number of files to be processed in a multipart file upload request. If the number of files uploaded exceeds this limit, then file upload processing is halted.

        If HTTP errors are enabled, and if this constraint is violated, then the HTTP error status REQUEST ENTITY TOO LARGE will be sent back to the client and the response will be closed.

        Returns:
        the maximum number of files to be processed. A value of 0 indicates no limit.
        Since:
        1.0

      • setFileUploadQuantityLimit

        void setFileUploadQuantityLimit(int quantityLimit)
        Sets the maximum number of files to be processed in a multipart file upload request.
        Parameters:
        quantityLimit - the limit, as a number of files. If 0, interpreted as "no quantity limit" (negative values are coerced to 0).
        Since:
        1.0

      • getFileUploadSizeLimit

        long getFileUploadSizeLimit()
        Gets the maximum size of each file to be processed in a multipart file upload request. If any file exceeds this size limit, then file upload processing is halted (even if there are other files that do not exceed the limit).

        If HTTP errors are enabled, and if this constraint is violated, then the HTTP error status REQUEST ENTITY TOO LARGE will be sent back to the client and the response will be closed.

        Returns:
        the maximum size (in bytes) of files to be processed. A value of 0 indicates no limit.
        Since:
        1.0

      • setFileUploadSizeLimit

        void setFileUploadSizeLimit(long sizeLimit)
        Sets the maximum size of each file to be processed in a multipart file upload request. When any file exceeds this size limit, file upload processing will be halted (even if there are other files that do not exceed the limit).
        Parameters:
        sizeLimit - the limit, as a number of bytes. If 0, interpreted as "no file size limit" (negative values are coerced to 0).
        Since:
        1.0
